history.content: I took the 61b and 16b combo. I did that because I just wanted to get ee16b out of the way. I think the most common schedule of classes would be to take 61a and 16a, 61b and 16b, 70 and 61c. I think the reason for this is so that no class for the cs major declaration overlaps with one another...ie it lets you focus more on one. However, I do know several people who took the combo of death you describe 70, 16b, 61b so it is doable but you just have to be careful of the workloads of each class. 61b can be very heavy depending on who you take it with.

children.subject: If I were to take all 3, I will most likely try to prep for cs70 over the summer by watching lectures and maybe attempting the homework. If I were to lighten the load this way, do you think I will still have time for recruiting in the fall too? Thank you!!

Probably, but depends on you (I know everyone hates this answer sorry). I have not put much effort into recruiting at my time here and can provide limited insight, so take this with caution. If you have other extracurricular commitments, you'll need to balance that. If you don't, then recruiting kind of is your extracurricular so you're probably chilling. When I took this combo, I was able to log ~55 hours over the semester as an AI for 61A, spend like ~3 hours a week on a sports club, and still goof off a bit on the weekends with friends. After the halfway point in the semester was reached, I would say at least half my weekend I was goofing off. I will admit that my weekdays got pretty brutal sometimes, but I never felt overwhelmed. My prep for this semester was going through the imt decal stuff (great material, highly recommend!) and watching all of the 16A circuits lectures (I took 54 instead of 16A, imo I think this gave me a better lin alg background). I would advise not only prepping for 70, but also for 61b (by doing the projects/labs) and 16B (going through course notes/reader, attempting discussion/csm worksheets). If you prep for all three classes, you will spend the least amount of time in the semester trying to figure out course material and the most amount of time actually doing homework, which should leave you time for doing what you want. Hopefully this gives you an idea of how much time you can spend on things with this type of schedule!
thank you for your input!! really appreciate it!!

Taking all three can work, and work well in my case, dependent on your background, willingness to work at it, and general satisfaction with the material; with 61b hug, it should be doable (imo less work/stress than 61b hilfinger even if you're a worse test taker). The combo works best if you actually enjoy your classes. I believe if needed to pick 2, take 61b hug and 16b Miki. Not only is 61b and 16b the department recommended combo, hug and miki are also great people in general and taking a class with them will be memorable. I also think taking a class with Rao is an experience everyone should have, as his sense of humor is unmatched by anyone in the department imo and his lectures should also be memorable but brutal lol. Take this with a grain of salt, many of my friends disagree with me with my opinions and different professors.

history.content: I'm wondering if I should take cs61b (hug) and cs70 vs cs61b and ee16b (Miki Lustig, Seth R Sanders). Is there any benefits of taking one over the other? I'm debating on whether or not I should try to hopefully declare earlier or take ee16b while the 16a content is still fresh in my mind. Would it be possible to take cs61b, cs70, and ee16b in one semester? I was also planning to self study cs70 over the summer to lighten up the workload during the school year. Thank you!
history.subject: cs61b and cs70 vs cs61b and ee16b
